channel.title: Byte Code [ASM, BCEL]
channel.description: How many of yours know about these libs and how many here know about it or what it does? and how useful it is?

item.title: Byte Code [ASM, BCEL]
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Ecko thinks he’s cool because he is not.

Read full topic

item.title: Byte Code [ASM, BCEL]
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“Echo_, post:6, topic:389181”]I learned a lot from this tutorial when I started learning BCEL, so try reading it over and testing some of the examples:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

As for your question about how useful it is, these libraries come in handy when you don’t want to look through a huge amount of decompiled code or simply don’t have access to the source code and have to make edits through bytecode. You can use them to build programs to dynamically find client fields for you as well(a hook updater for example).

Those are just a few examples of what you can use it for, the possibilities are endless.[/quote]
yo wtf name jacker

Read full topic

item.title: Byte Code [ASM, BCEL]
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

I learned a lot from this tutorial when I started learning BCEL, so try reading it over and testing some of the examples:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

As for your question about how useful it is, these libraries come in handy when you don’t want to look through a huge amount of decompiled code or simply don’t have access to the source code and have to make edits through bytecode. You can use them to build programs to dynamically find client fields for you as well(a hook updater for example).

Those are just a few examples of what you can use it for, the possibilities are endless.

item.title: Byte Code [ASM, BCEL]
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:1, topic:258519”]Bots have little, if anything, to do with the progression of RSC server development. Topics that are bot-related are no longer welcome in this section.

All bot-related topics will be removed.[/quote]

I wonder if this rule still stands. Wouldn’t see why not.

Other than that…

Salty FIsh:

Seeming as each one of yours if you build a bot or etc you think you have to decompile the client fix the decompiler errors then bang go…But really you do not even have to do the half of that.

Of course not…

contact “object” about his latest project.

Seeming as each one of yours if you build a bot or etc you think you have to decompile the client fix the decompiler errors then bang go…

But really you do not even have to do the half of that. It’s bit mind bobbling why yours do it like yours do.
